title: Veteran Crisis Support: Free Hotlines, Grants, and Emergency Help
seoTitle: Veteran Crisis Help: Hotlines, Grants & Support
summary: Veterans facing homelessness, eviction, or mental health crises can access free support from the VA and partner organizations. Learn about crisis lines, housing grants, and urgent aid.

body.raw:
## Introduction Life after service can be difficult â€” especially when facing unemployment, housing insecurity, or mental health struggles. Fortunately, **veterans can access 24/7 crisis support and emergency financial help** through federal and nonprofit programs. *** ## 1. VA Crisis Hotline (24/7) Call or text **988 (then press 1)** to reach the VA Crisis Line â€” available 24/7 for: - Suicidal thoughts - Substance abuse - PTSD episodes - Isolation or hopelessness They can dispatch mobile crisis units or connect you to local VA care. ## 2. Emergency Financial Help & Housing If you're facing eviction or homelessness: - Contact **VA Homeless Programs** via [877-4AID-VET (877-424-3838)](tel:8774243838) - Apply for **SSVF (Supportive Services for Veteran Families)** â€” may cover: - Rent - Utility bills - Moving costs - Find local partners via [va.gov/homeless](https://www.va.gov/homeless/) If you're worried about losing your home, you may qualify for rent help through the VA â€” or [explore other affordable housing programs available to veterans.](./va-housing-assistance-how-veterans-can-buy-refinance-or-avoid-foreclosure?fromTag=veterans) ## 3. Other Urgent Resources - **VFW Unmet Needs Program:** Up to $1,500 in emergency grants [vfw.org/UnmetNeeds](https://www.vfw.org/UnmetNeeds) - **Operation Homefront:** Help for veterans with children - **DAV:** Helps with benefits claims, transportation, and legal aid > ðŸ’¡ You donâ€™t need to be receiving VA disability to qualify for crisis help. *** ###### References
Veterans Crisis Line
VA Homeless Services
Operation Homefront
Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Resources
